title: Day 1247
content:
# Day 1247

**Day One Of A Three Day Fast Has Begun: LFG!**

This fast feels different from some of the others I've done. Better somehow. There's a peculiar alchemy at work on day one, a sense of clarity emerging from emptiness, energy rising from deprivation. Your frequency shifts higher, as if hunger has tuned your consciousness to a sharper wavelength.

But the body keeps its own accounting. You can feel it beginning to consume itself, a quiet cannibalism that whispers beneath the mental clarity. The paradox is a bit maddening if I'm being honest. Your mind buzzes with electric focus while simultaneously running on fumes. Your eyes strain against their sockets, exhausted, yet your thoughts cut through fog like light through crystal, though this crystalline clarity proves fleeting as the fast deepens.

It's impossible to capture in words, this contradiction. If you want to "get it" you should probably try fasting yourself. The brain insists it's starving while performing at peak clarity.

Fasting remains one of life's strangest gifts, this deliberate withholding that somehow gives back more than it takes. The body learns to remember what it can do without, finds strength in emptiness, discovers that reset and renewal live on the other side of discomfort. Shout out God for giving me the will power to do this fast. As I mentioned earlier in another medium I needed to do a fast this month. Well now it's here.

Of course, in my infinite wisdom, or perhaps my infinite vanity, I decided today was perfect for a workout and run. It actually felt really good. I only ran a mile and it was a light workout because I did not want to hurt myself.

Now exhaustion settles in like an old friend. Tonight, I'll sleep the deep, earned sleep of deliberate struggle, the kind that only comes when you've pushed through discomfort and found grace on the other side. Like a champion, even if I can barely spell it, lol.
